name: Perfix
description: ULTRA Performance Profiler & Optimizer. Comprehensive profiling of shaders, particles, effects, collisions, visibility, camera, actions, triggers, batch nodes, draw calls. Find EXACTLY what's causing lag!

show-profiler.name: Show Profiler Overlay
show-profiler.description: Main profiler display showing FPS, frame times, object counts, component timings, batch nodes, draw calls, and optimization stats.

show-detailed-profiler.name: Show Detailed Breakdown
show-detailed-profiler.description: Shows additional detailed breakdown panel on the right side with percentage breakdowns, individual component timings, and deep profiling data.

disable-shaders.name: Disable ALL Shaders
disable-shaders.description: Completely disables all shader effects including chromatic aberration, sepia, glitch, blur, pixelate, bulge, shockwave, lens distortion, motion blur, and all other post-processing effects. This is the BIGGEST performance boost for levels with shader triggers.

disable-particles.name: Disable Particle Systems
disable-particles.description: Disables all particle effects including fire, dust, explosions, sparkles, glitter, and object particles. Significant performance boost for particle-heavy levels.

reduced-particles.name: Reduced Particles (Half Updates)
reduced-particles.description: Updates particles every other frame instead of every frame. Less aggressive than fully disabling - keeps visuals but improves performance.

disable-glow.name: Disable Glow Effects
disable-glow.description: Disables glow sprites on objects and player. Reduces GPU overdraw from additive blending. Good for glow-heavy decoration levels.

disable-trails.name: Disable Ghost Trails
disable-trails.description: Disables player ghost trail snapshots. Removes the fading trail behind the player icon.

disable-pulse.name: Disable Pulse Triggers
disable-pulse.description: Blocks NEW pulse triggers from activating. Existing pulses will complete normally to avoid color bugs. Helps in levels with many pulse triggers.

disable-shake.name: Disable Camera Shake
disable-shake.description: Disables all camera shake effects from shake triggers. Also helps reduce motion sickness.

disable-move-effects.name: Disable Opacity Effects (Android Only)
disable-move-effects.description: Disables opacity fade animations from alpha triggers. NOTE: Only works on Android due to Windows function inlining.

disable-high-detail.name: Disable High-Detail Objects
disable-high-detail.description: Skips activation of objects marked as 'high detail'. Similar to the in-game Low Detail Mode but more aggressive.

exp-throttle-actions.name: [EXP] Throttle Move/Rotate Actions
exp-throttle-actions.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Processes move and rotation triggers every other frame instead of every frame. Can significantly reduce lag in levels with many moving objects but may cause slight visual stuttering.

exp-skip-area-effects.name: [EXP] Skip Area Effects
exp-skip-area-effects.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Completely skips area effect processing (area fade, area tint, etc). Major performance boost in levels using area triggers but breaks those effects.

exp-throttle-transforms.name: [EXP] Throttle Transform Updates
exp-throttle-transforms.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Only processes transform actions on visible frames. Can reduce CPU load but may cause objects to lag behind.

exp-throttle-spawns.name: [EXP] Throttle Spawn Triggers
exp-throttle-spawns.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Limits spawn trigger rate by adding a minimum delay between spawns. Helps with spawn loop lag but may break some level mechanics.

exp-reduce-collision-checks.name: [EXP] Reduce Collision Checks
exp-reduce-collision-checks.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Checks collisions every other frame for non-hazard objects. Reduces CPU load but may cause slight collision detection delays.

exp-aggressive-culling.name: [EXP] Aggressive Visibility Culling
exp-aggressive-culling.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Uses tighter section bounds for visibility, culling more off-screen objects. May cause pop-in at screen edges.

exp-skip-follow-actions.name: [EXP] Skip Follow Actions
exp-skip-follow-actions.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Disables follow trigger processing entirely. Breaks follow triggers but significantly reduces CPU in follow-heavy levels.

exp-reduce-color-updates.name: [EXP] Reduce Color Updates (Android Only)
exp-reduce-color-updates.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Updates color channels at half rate. NOTE: Only works on Android due to Windows function inlining. May cause slight color animation lag.

exp-throttle-gradients.name: [EXP] Throttle Gradient Layers
exp-throttle-gradients.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Updates gradient layers every 3rd frame instead of every frame. Reduces GPU color blending overhead in gradient-heavy levels.

exp-reduce-wave-trail.name: [EXP] Reduce Wave Trail Quality
exp-reduce-wave-trail.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Reduces wave trail (HardStreak) update frequency. Lowers vertex buffer updates for smoother wave gameplay at cost of trail quality.

exp-throttle-advanced-follow.name: [EXP] Throttle Advanced Follow
exp-throttle-advanced-follow.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Processes advanced follow triggers every other frame. Reduces complex physics calculations in modern 2.2 levels.

exp-throttle-dynamic-objects.name: [EXP] Throttle Dynamic Objects
exp-throttle-dynamic-objects.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Throttles dynamic move/rotate commands processing. Helps with levels that have many dynamically moving objects.

exp-throttle-player-follow.name: [EXP] Throttle Player Follow
exp-throttle-player-follow.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Reduces player follow trigger update rate. Helps in levels with many follow-player triggers.

exp-limit-enter-effects.name: [EXP] Limit Enter Effects
exp-limit-enter-effects.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Limits concurrent enter effect transitions. Reduces lag when many objects enter screen at once.

exp-throttle-labels.name: [EXP] Throttle Label Updates (Android Only)
exp-throttle-labels.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Updates counter/timer labels every 5th frame. Reduces text rendering overhead in label-heavy levels. NOTE: Only works on Android due to Windows function inlining.
